conclusion: Equilateral triangular frame ABC made of uniform resistance wires is placed perpendicular to a magnetic field.
Points A and B are connected to a power supply with constant voltage, and current flows through the circuit.
Ampere force on segment AB is given as F.
Current divides between two paths: directly through AB and through AC and CB.
Resistance is proportional to length; path ACB has twice the resistance of path AB.
Current through path ACB is half of the current through AB (I₂ = I₁/2).
Ampere force formula: F = ILBsinθ, where θ = 90° and sin(θ) = 1.
Force on segment AB is F, direction is perpendicular to current and magnetic field.
Force magnitude on segment AC is F/2, direction is perpendicular to current and magnetic field.
Force magnitude on segment CB is F/2, direction is perpendicular to current and magnetic field.
Direction of force on AB is downward.
Direction of force on AC is at 60° right of downward.
Direction of force on CB is at 60° left of downward.
Horizontal components of forces on AC and CB cancel out.
Vertical components of forces add up to 3F/2.
Resultant force is purely vertical with magnitude 3F/2.
Magnitude of the resultant Ampere force on the three resistance wires is 3F/2.
